job.title: Lead Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Kent
job.description: Job Title: Lead Direct Support Professional Reports To: Residential Administrator Job Area: Kent, WA Working Schedule: Monday - Friday 7a-3p Number of Positions Open: 1 SUMMARY- Provides personalized supports to ensure supported clients’ safety and health is maintained and they can experience the nature and quality of life of their choice based on their needs, preferences, aspirations and decisions. Service provisions focus on maintaining or enhancing the clients’ dignity, well-being, autonomy, personal choice, self-esteem and teaching functional skills that are alternatives to maladaptive behaviors. Supervision, protection and care of clients individually and in-groups at all times. Documentation of their progress; identification of the possible need for professional services; and communication of such findings to Supervisor. Compensation & Benefits: $21 - $23 per hour Voluntary Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Voluntary Short-term and Long-term Disability Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Company Paid Basic Life Insurance & ADD plus Voluntary Life Insurance Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO Vacation & Sick Time) Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Working Advantage employee discount program Health Savings Account (HSA) Flexible Savings Account (FSA) 401(K) Capella University Discount DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: May include but are not limited to the following: Responsible for the Care, Health, Safety, and Supervision of clients, this is the number one priority Shifts on floor of 6 to 8 hours daily. Must have a willingness to move programs as directed by supervisor as needed and/or without notice. In charge of keeping facility in compliance. Responsible for maintaining a clean, safe, stimulating living environment. Perform normal household cleaning, including vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, dusting, scrubbing, washing dishes, laundry and keeping closets/drawers organized and neat. Assist residents with all household chores. Maintain the house neat and clean at all times. Responsible for the overall cleanliness of the home. Monitor or provide assistance and/or instruction to individual with dressing, grooming, bathing, toileting, eating and sleeping habits as needed. Assist with wheelchair use, including pushing, folding/unfolding, and loading into autos. Support Supervisors in creating menus, shopping, and safe food storage for client. Prepare, provide instruction and/or assist in preparing nutritious meal that reflect individual preferences. Will follow the direction of the Supervisor to implement the program plan. Review documentation and discuss items with staff. Will assist in keeping accurate data on the residents’ progress towards their individual goals. Engage the residents on all tasks, training and community integration activities. Report all incidents and occurrences to Supervisor including all incidents of possible abuse or neglect. Report to Supervisor any resident’s needs that implies to be requested to the agencies. Will always present yourself appropriately, and as a role model for clients and other Direct Care Staff at home and in the community. Follow dress code. Will attend any meeting and training per Supervisor request. Will dispense or supervise dispensing of medication to clients. Support Supervisors by coordinating staff for medical appointments and activities. Assist Supervisors in the creation of the Activity Calendar with the staff and clients’ input. Follow activities scheduled, keep residents active and always give them a choice. Provide transportation to clients. Follow established formal behavior support plans and guidelines for positive behavior support programs as outlined. Assist in developing positive behavior supports by providing feedback about clients’ preferences. Support client’s participation in cultural, recreational, and educational activities both at home and in the community. Follow established emergency plan and procedures. Will document all occurrences and observations on their proper forms every shift. Provides leadership by displaying positive conduct and demonstrates initiative to enhance program. Resolves routine problems that arise and contact Supervisor if serious problems arise (behavioral crisis, medical crisis, etc.) Ensures proper maintenance and care of existing supplies, furnishings and equipment. Receive receipts and documents for client finances. Maintains clients’ confidentiality whenever appropriate. Refers sensitive communications to FOS. Maintains Confidentiality Regs. FOLLOW ALL COMPANY RULES AND PROCEDURES. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty assigned, satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 18 years old and have at least one-year experience working with people with behavioral challenges and developmental disabilities. All staff are required to possess the following prior to employment: No DUIs or dangerous driving, Be an insured, licensed driver Staff will be assessed for their patience and capacity to work with very difficult behaviors and their overall people skills. All staff will be evaluated annually or as needed to assess if they are appropriate for the position and if they should continue employment Pass a state background check Be Vaccinated for COVID-19 or have an approved exemption The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required: LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and interpret documents in the English language such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before representatives from various agencies, Residents and co-workers. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in standardized situations. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds, and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee must be available to participate in restraining of a Resident, upon need. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently works in outside weather conditions. The employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and risk of electrical shock typical of a residential setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud. SPECIAL SKILLS NEEDED: · -Must be patient and have a capacity to work with very difficult behaviors. -Must have good overall people skills -Be able to speak, read and write in English in a comprehensible level to satisfactorily carry out all the duties included in this job description. SSAILS Washington is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website @ https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ PandoLogic. Keywords: Residential Services Coordinator, Location: Tacoma, WA - 98403 , PL: 569325883

job.title: Direct Support Professional - Scottsdale, AZ
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Job Title: Group Home Staff Hourly Rate : $16.00 Shifts Needed : Multiple Job Status : Full Time, Part Time Work Locations : Scottsdale, Tempe, and Mesa Driving required: YesJob description On Angel’s Wings is looking to hire several care giving positions that work with adults with developmental disabilities. In this role, you will be responsible for the care and supervision of adults with developmental disabilities. This includes behavior management, habilitation goals, medication administration and daily living skills. These shifts are in Scottsdale near 70th st and Thomas. Part time-shift: Friday from 3pm to 9pm, Saturday and Sunday from 11am to 11pm Full time- shift: Friday from 9pm to Saturday 11am, Saturday from 9pm to Sunday 11am, Sunday from 9pm to Monday 9am. These shifts are in Scottsdale near 75th st and McDowell. Shift: Saturday and Sunday from 12am to 12pm, Monday and Tuesday from 2pm to 10pm Shift: Sunday from 12pm to 12am, Monday and Tuesday from 2pm to 12am, Wednesday from 2pm to 10pm These shifts are in Mesa near Sossaman and Guadalupe. Shift:Tuesday and Wednesday from 3pm to 9pm, Thursday and Friday from 3pm to 11pm, Saturday from 11am to 11pm. Shift: Sunday from 11am to 11pm, Monday through Wednesday from 2pm to 11pm This shift is in Tempe near Mill and Baseline Shift: (Part-time) Thursday from 2pm to 9pm, Friday from 2pm to 11pm, Saturday from 11am to 11pm. Responsibilities: Group home staff will be responsible for the care and supervision of adults with Developmental Disabilities. Supervision and care of individuals Assisting in daily living skills Behavior management Medication administration Transportation of members with the use of a company van Highlighted below are our minimum requirements to get you started in the group homes. Must have a high school diploma or G.E.D Must be 21+ years old. Must be able to pass a Criminal Background and Fingerprint Clearance Card. We will assist you with obtaining the card. Valid AZ driver's license (driving will be required) Must have a clean 39-month motor vehicle record. Preferred Qualifications: We offer paid training for the Department of Developmental Disabilities required certifications. Current Certifications (CPR, First Aid, Prevention and Support, Article 9, and DCW) Experience in Group Homes, DTA's, HCBS, or DTT's a plus. Experience as a Direct Support Professional Visit our website at https://onangelswingsaz.com/ Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. job.description: Looking for strong self-starting on-site Management Team for a 34 unit apartment complex in University Place, WA, part of a small family-owned organization. job.title: Caregiver/Direct Support Professional-IRVINE (Walkins) $500 SIGN ON BONUS
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Caregiver/Direct Support Professional-IRVINE (Walkins) $500 SIGN ON BONUS Job Title : Direct Support Professional (DSP) Hourly Rate : $17.00 -$18.00 Shifts Needed : AM / PM shifts Job Status : Full Time and Part Time Work Locations : Irvine, CA DATE: Walkins Tuesdays & Thursdays TIME:10am-2pm LOCATION:505 N Tustin Ave #114, Santa Ana, CA 92705 SAILS Group, Inc. is now hiring for Part-Time and Full-Time Direct Care Staff. Paid training provided! Hiring for all shifts; including morning, day, afternoon, evening, overnights, weekdays, weekends and holidays. PT and FT hours available. We are hiring in the Orange County area and we provide residential caregiving for adolescents and adults with developmental disabilities. Who is SAILS Group? The SAILS Group, Inc. (Supported And Independent Living Services) is an international agency committed to the quality of care, supervision and training of adults and children with intellectual and developmental disabilities. With over 25 years of service, we specialize in the most behaviorally challenged individuals and are known for our holistic, non-aversive training methods. When possible, we help these individuals develop skills, earn income, and live an integrated life in their communities. Why Work for Us? We have an amazing team who are passionate and committed to our consumers' success and who will help and guide you along the way! We offer paid training to obtain outside credentials such as Crisis Prevention and Intervention (CPI) We are GROWING and there are many opportunities for you to grow with us! Benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits for full-time employees Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Insurance for all employees Paid sick time off and Holiday Pay Paid Continuing Education training Access to National University with 15% discounted rates towards coursework Identity verification for obtaining bank accounts, cell phone accounts, and more! Opportunities for growth Raises and promotions for amazing performance $500 Sign-On Bonus Paid after 90 Days of employment Join our team and be part of the change we are making! Duties and Responsibilities: To provide training on behavioral, social, independence and community involvement skills to individuals with developmental disabilities. Will train and manage consumers using the Kids First Foundation philosophy and approach of always being “Fair, Firm and Consistent”. Implement the consumer’s objectives and behavior support plans as instructed. May assist individuals with their personal care needs (ADLs) as necessary to maintain hygiene. Report any and all incidents, behaviors and occurrences immediately to the support manager including incidents of possible abuse or neglect. Assist consumers with all their household chores as necessary. May supervise of assist consumers with medications as needed. Attend weekly contact meeting with support manager and monthly in-services. If and when working a night shift will be responsible for and alert to consumer’s nighttime awakenings and behaviors. Use physical restraint only as a last resort if the individual served is becoming a danger to self or others, using only CPI techniques. Qualifications Possess High School Diploma or equivalent Hold a valid California Driver's License in good standing; with insurance Applicant must be certified in First Aid and CPR by the first day of employment Must pass background check If you are looking for a career, where you can be that support system to the disabled population APPLY NOW! If you are unfamiliar with the job title of “Direct Care Staff (DCS): Similar job titles are Caregiver, Personal Care Attendant (PCA) Home Health Aid, Certified Nursing Assistant, Direct Support Professional or Direct Care Provider. Our goal is to provide a supported, independent, and safe living environment for our clients! Please feel free to visit our website at http://sailsgroup.org/ for more information Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Caregiver, Location: Huntington Beach, CA - 92605 , PL: 569325992

job.title: Vehicle Maintenance Team Lead
job.description: Create Your Experience of a Lifetime! ​ Come work and play in the mountains! Whether it’s your first time seeing the mountains, or you already call them home, joining our team means discovering (or re-discovering!) a passion for the outdoors while building lifelong connections with teammates and guests from around the world. ​ With 40+ resorts and our remote Corporate team, you can join for a season or stay to build a career. From day one, you'll receive some of the highest compensation rates in the industry, free Epic pass(es), 40% retail discounts, summer activities discounts, wellness benefits, and the chance to grow through Epic Service - our leading training and development experience. Job Benefits Ski/Mountain Perks! Free passes for employees, employee discounted lift tickets for friends and family AND free ski lessons MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, mountain shuttles AND during the summer on bike haul, golf and other activities 401(k) Retirement Plan Employee Assistance Program Excellent training and professional development Referral Program Full Time roles are eligible for the above, plus: Health Insurance; Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, and Vision Insurance plans (for eligible seasonal employees after working 500 hours) Free ski passes for dependents Critical Illness and Accident plans Job Summary: Our year-round Vehicle Maintenance team executes safety best practices to the best of our ability, as well as maintain a fun, friendly, and positive attitude every day, with all guests and employees. We are an internal based guest service department; we want to make sure we leave our teams with a positive experience. This role provides maintenance and repair services for our state of the art fleet. This position is eligible for a tool allowance, ski pass, along with other benefits found here! Job Specifications: Expected Pay Range: $27.00 - $33.00 / hour Shift & Schedule Availability: Full-Time Skill Level: Team Lead Our Fleet: Snowcats Snowmobiles Heavy Equipment Light Duty Trucks Shuttle and Transit Buses Small Engine Equipment Job Responsibilities: Trains and instructs personnel in the safe operation of fleet equipment such as overhead cranes, vehicle maintenance lifts, measurement and diagnostic equipment, forklifts and hand tools Diagnoses and performs major repairs and overhauls to gasoline and diesel engines, inspects, troubleshoots, diagnoses, repairs, cleans, adjusts and installs fuel, ignition, electrical, cooling system, hydraulic system parts and/or controls, and welding Diagnoses and performs electrical, hydraulic and other repairs in the field Inspects, services and repairs vehicle braking systems; diagnoses, repairs and maintains vehicle air brakes, hydraulic systems and associated power take-off equipment Provide daily supervision and oversight of all team staff and ongoing projects occurring within the Fleet Maintenance operation Assist management with developing the best possible fleet management program to ensure optimal purchasing plans and the rotation of existing fleet for the best optimization and utilization of the fleet Adhere and promote company safety policies and programs Other duties as assigned Job Requirements: Experience in Automotive, Truck, Heavy Equipment, Fleet diagnostics and repair Ability to analyze complex vehicle and equipment problems, evaluate alternatives and recommend or adopt appropriate courses of action Must have a valid driver’s license / pass internal MVR check Must have own tools and be willing to purchase more as necessary Must have the ability to lift 50 pounds regularly The expected pay range is $27.00 - $33.00. This is the pay range we reasonably expect to pay for this position. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors. Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. Requisition ID 495086

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse-Inglewood
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Licensed Vocational Nurse-Los Angeles/Inglewood Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse Hourly Rate :$35.00 Shifts Needed : PM, Full time Work Locations : Los Angeles/Inglewood, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM, PM , Overnights Work Location: One location Apply at: www.redwoodfcn.com/careers Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Inglewood, CA - 90311 , PL: 569254490

job.title: Lead Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Auburn, WA
job.description: Job Title: Lead Direct Support Professional Reports To: Residential Administrator Job Area: Auburn, WA Working Schedule: Monday - Friday, this role can work either 7am-3pm OR 3pm-11pm POSITION SUMMARY- The Lead Direct Support Professional provides personalized supports to ensure supported clients’ safety and health is maintained and they can experience the nature and quality of life of their choice based on their needs, preferences, aspirations and decisions. The Lead Direct Support Professional provides service provisions focused on maintaining or enhancing the clients’ dignity, well-being, autonomy, personal choice, self-esteem and teaching functional skills that are alternatives to maladaptive behaviors. The Lead Direct Support Professional provides supervision, protection and care of clients individually and in-groups at all times. Documentation of their progress; identification of the possible need for professional services; and communication of such findings to the Administrator. Compensation & Benefits: $20 - $22 per hour Voluntary Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Voluntary Short-term and Long-term Disability Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Company Paid Basic Life Insurance & ADD plus Voluntary Life Insurance Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO Vacation & Sick Time) Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Working Advantage employee discount program Health Savings Account (HSA) Flexible Savings Account (FSA) 401(K) Capella University Discount DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: May include but are not limited to the following: Responsible for the Care, Health, Safety, and Supervision of clients, this is the number one priority Must have a willingness to move programs as directed by supervisor as needed and/or without notice. In charge of keeping facility in compliance. Responsible for maintaining a clean, safe, stimulating living environment. Perform normal household cleaning, including vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, dusting, scrubbing, washing dishes, laundry and keeping closets/drawers organized and neat. Assist residents with all household chores. Maintain the house neat and clean at all times. Responsible for the overall cleanliness of the home. Monitor or provide assistance and/or instruction to individual with dressing, grooming, bathing, toileting, eating and sleeping habits as needed. Assist with wheelchair use, including pushing, folding/unfolding, and loading into autos. Support Supervisors in creating menus, shopping, and safe food storage for client. Prepare, provide instruction and/or assist in preparing nutritious meal that reflect individual preferences. Will follow the direction of the Supervisor to implement the program plan. Review documentation and discuss items with staff. Will assist in keeping accurate data on the residents’ progress towards their individual goals. Engage the residents on all tasks, training and community integration activities. Report all incidents and occurrences to Supervisor including all incidents of possible abuse or neglect. Report to Supervisor any resident’s needs that implies to be requested to the agencies. Will always present yourself appropriately, and as a role model for clients and other Direct Care Staff at home and in the community. Follow dress code. Will attend any meeting and training per Supervisor request. Will dispense or supervise dispensing of medication to clients. Support Supervisors by coordinating staff for medical appointments and activities. Assist Supervisors in the creation of the Activity Calendar with the staff and clients’ input. Follow activities scheduled, keep residents active and always give them a choice. Provide transportation to clients. Follow established formal behavior support plans and guidelines for positive behavior support programs as outlined. Assist in developing positive behavior supports by providing feedback about clients’ preferences. Support client’s participation in cultural, recreational, and educational activities both at home and in the community. Follow established emergency plan and procedures. Will document all occurrences and observations on their proper forms every shift. Provides leadership by displaying positive conduct and demonstrates initiative to enhance program. Resolves routine problems that arise and contact Supervisor if serious problems arise (behavioral crisis, medical crisis, etc.) Ensures proper maintenance and care of existing supplies, furnishings and equipment. Receive receipts and documents for client finances. Maintains clients’ confidentiality whenever appropriate. Refers sensitive communications to FOS. Maintains Confidentiality Regs. FOLLOW ALL COMPANY RULES AND PROCEDURES. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty assigned, satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 18 years old and have at least one-year experience working with people with behavioral challenges and developmental disabilities. All staff are required to possess the following prior to employment: No DUIs or dangerous driving, Be an insured, licensed driver Staff will be assessed for their patience and capacity to work with very difficult behaviors and their overall people skills. All staff will be evaluated annually or as needed to assess if they are appropriate for the position and if they should continue employment Pass a state background check Be Vaccinated for COVID-19 or have an approved exemption The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required: LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and interpret documents in the English language such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before representatives from various agencies, Residents and co-workers. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in standardized situations. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds, and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee must be available to participate in restraining of a Resident, upon need. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently works in outside weather conditions. The employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and risk of electrical shock typical of a residential setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud. SPECIAL SKILLS NEEDED: · -Must be patient and have a capacity to work with very difficult behaviors. -Must have good overall people skills -Be able to speak, read and write in English in a comprehensible level to satisfactorily carry out all the duties included in this job description. SSAILS Washington is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website @ https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ PandoLogic. Keywords: Residential Services Coordinator, Location: Bellevue, WA - 98005 , PL: 569326088

job.title: Direct Support Professional (Shoreline, WA) FT Day Shift
job.description: Job Title: Direct Support Professional Reports To: Residential Administrator Job Location: Shoreline, WA Hourly Compensation: $19 - 21.50 per hour Shifts Needed: Sun - Thurs 7am - 3pm Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Do you enjoy seeing the long-lasting impact your efforts make? If you said YES, then we’d love for you to apply today! Sails WA is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. The Direct Support Professionals role at Sails WA is to support adults with developmental or intellectual disabilities to have a higher quality of life. A DSP promotes the health, safety and well-being of the people we support. A DSP will also serve as an advocate for the people we support and their rights. Compensation & Benefits: $19 - 21.50 per hour Voluntary Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Voluntary Short-term and Long-term Disability Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Company Paid Basic Life Insurance & ADD plus Voluntary Life Insurance Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO Vacation & Sick Time) Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Working Advantage employee discount program Health Savings Account (HSA) Flexible Savings Account (FSA) 401(K) Capella University Discount Responsibilities Include but not limited to: Under the direction of the Program Administrator, the DSP will provide each participant with an array of instruction and support services, as described in the participants’ Individual Instruction and Support Plan (IISP). Ensures that the daily needs of the participants are met, including personal hygiene, food preparation, house cleaning, shopping, and monitoring of health needs, supervision of medication. Assists participants with regularly accessing the community to take part in a variety of outings of the participants’ choosing. This may require transporting participants or arranging for transportation. Ensures that participants are treated with dignity and consideration at all times. Promotes and safeguards each participant’s ability to make decisions and to freely exercise his/her rights. Requirements & Qualifications: Both written and spoken English language proficiency required High School Diploma / Equivalent required Washington State Driver’s License, a Reliable Vehicle, Auto Insurance, and must be willing to transport clients Must be located in & eligible/authorized to work in the United States Must be willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations First Aid/CPR Certified (within 120 days of employment, training can be provided) Have an active NAR/HCA/CNA (within 120 days of employment) Blood Borne Pathogen (within 120 days of employment, training can be provided) Must be able to lift 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions Be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 (or have an approved exemption) For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website: https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ SUPPORT . ADVOCACY . INDEPENDENCE . LIVING . SERVICE PandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Snohomish, WA - 98290 , PL: 569325812

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse-Inglewood
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Licensed Vocational Nurse-Los Angeles/Inglewood Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse Hourly Rate :$35.00 Shifts Needed : PM, Full time Work Locations : Los Angeles/Inglewood, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM, PM , Overnights Work Location: One location Apply at: www.redwoodfcn.com/careers Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: El Monte, CA - 91735 , PL: 569325836

People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM, PM , Overnights Work Location: One location VISIT OUR CAREER WEBSITE AT www.peoplescare.com COVID-19 considerations: Must be fully Vaccinated or have a medical/religious willing to get weekly tested in homes. Providing Excellent Support and Advocacy PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Manteca, CA - 95336 , PL: 569326046

job.description: Responsible for assisting with professional nursing care for SIH patients with an RN preceptor Responsibilities Safety · Manages processes effectively in regard to employee/patient safety. · Record Keeping · Maintains all required records, reports, statistics, logs, files and other documents as required, including but not limited to payroll, schedules and status changes. · Process Improvement · Promotes a culture of process improvement by establishing unit/department based programs that supports the system & process improvement goals.Actively participates on system-wide or hospital-based teams. · Collects data and collaborating in the assessment of the health status of a patient · Collaborates in the development and modification of the RN’s comprehensive nursing plan of care for all types of patients. · Implements aspects of the plan of care as delegated. · Participates in health teaching and counseling to promote, attain, and maintain the optimum health level of patients as delegated. · Serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service personnel as delegated. · Participates in the evaluation of patient responses to interventions. · Communicates and collaborates with other health care professionals as delegated. · Provides input into the development of policies and procedures to support patient safety. · Provides patient/family instructions. · Qualifications · Graduate of LPN Program · Currently Enrolled in RN completion program #PIQnursing PandoLogic. job.title: Lead Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Kirkland, WA
job.description: Job Title: Lead Direct Support Professional Reports To: Residential Administrator Job Area: Kirkland, WA Working Schedule: Monday - Friday 7a-3p SUMMARY- The Lead Direct Support Professional provides personalized supports to ensure supported clients’ safety and health is maintained and they can experience the nature and quality of life of their choice based on their needs, preferences, aspirations and decisions. The Lead Direct Support Professional provides service provisions focused on maintaining or enhancing the clients’ dignity, well-being, autonomy, personal choice, self-esteem and teaching functional skills that are alternatives to maladaptive behaviors. The Lead Direct Support Professional provides supervision, protection and care of clients individually and in-groups at all times. Documentation of their progress; identification of the possible need for professional services; and communication of such findings to the Administrator. Compensation & Benefits: $21 - $23 per hour Voluntary Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Voluntary Short-term and Long-term Disability Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Company Paid Basic Life Insurance & ADD plus Voluntary Life Insurance Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO Vacation & Sick Time) Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Working Advantage employee discount program Health Savings Account (HSA) Flexible Savings Account (FSA) 401(K) Capella University Discount DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: May include but are not limited to the following: Responsible for the Care, Health, Safety, and Supervision of clients, this is the number one priority Must have a willingness to move programs as directed by supervisor as needed and/or without notice. In charge of keeping facility in compliance. Responsible for maintaining a clean, safe, stimulating living environment. Perform normal household cleaning, including vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, dusting, scrubbing, washing dishes, laundry and keeping closets/drawers organized and neat. Assist residents with all household chores. Maintain the house neat and clean at all times. Responsible for the overall cleanliness of the home. Monitor or provide assistance and/or instruction to individual with dressing, grooming, bathing, toileting, eating and sleeping habits as needed. Assist with wheelchair use, including pushing, folding/unfolding, and loading into autos. Support Supervisors in creating menus, shopping, and safe food storage for client. Prepare, provide instruction and/or assist in preparing nutritious meal that reflect individual preferences. Will follow the direction of the Supervisor to implement the program plan. Review documentation and discuss items with staff. Will assist in keeping accurate data on the residents’ progress towards their individual goals. Engage the residents on all tasks, training and community integration activities. Report all incidents and occurrences to Supervisor including all incidents of possible abuse or neglect. Report to Supervisor any resident’s needs that implies to be requested to the agencies. Will always present yourself appropriately, and as a role model for clients and other Direct Care Staff at home and in the community. Follow dress code. Will attend any meeting and training per Supervisor request. Will dispense or supervise dispensing of medication to clients. Support Supervisors by coordinating staff for medical appointments and activities. Assist Supervisors in the creation of the Activity Calendar with the staff and clients’ input. Follow activities scheduled, keep residents active and always give them a choice. Provide transportation to clients. Follow established formal behavior support plans and guidelines for positive behavior support programs as outlined. Assist in developing positive behavior supports by providing feedback about clients’ preferences. Support client’s participation in cultural, recreational, and educational activities both at home and in the community. Follow established emergency plan and procedures. Will document all occurrences and observations on their proper forms every shift. Provides leadership by displaying positive conduct and demonstrates initiative to enhance program. Resolves routine problems that arise and contact Supervisor if serious problems arise (behavioral crisis, medical crisis, etc.) Ensures proper maintenance and care of existing supplies, furnishings and equipment. Receive receipts and documents for client finances. Maintains clients’ confidentiality whenever appropriate. Refers sensitive communications to FOS. Maintains Confidentiality Regs. FOLLOW ALL COMPANY RULES AND PROCEDURES. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Prior experience supporting people with wheelchairs and Hoyer lifts. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty assigned, satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be at least 18 years old and have at least one-year experience working with people with behavioral challenges and developmental disabilities. All staff are required to possess the following prior to employment: No DUIs or dangerous driving, Be an insured, licensed driver Staff will be assessed for their patience and capacity to work with very difficult behaviors and their overall people skills. All staff will be evaluated annually or as needed to assess if they are appropriate for the position and if they should continue employment Pass a state background check Be Vaccinated for COVID-19 or have an approved exemption The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required: LANGUAGE SKILLS: Ability to read and interpret documents in the English language such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before representatives from various agencies, Residents and co-workers. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several variables in standardized situations. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move more than 100 pounds, and frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The employee must be available to participate in restraining of a Resident, upon need. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently works in outside weather conditions. The employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts and is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and risk of electrical shock typical of a residential setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud. SPECIAL SKILLS NEEDED: · -Must be patient and have a capacity to work with very difficult behaviors. -Must have good overall people skills -Be able to speak, read and write in English in a comprehensible level to satisfactorily carry out all the duties included in this job description. SSAILS Washington is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website @ https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ PandoLogic. Keywords: Residential Services Coordinator, Location: Bellevue, WA - 98005 , PL: 569325806

job.title: Sourcing Specialist
job.description: Job Type Full-time Description Company Overview: Quantic TRM specializes in the design and manufacture of RF/Microwave components and integrated subsystem assemblies, providing both customized solutions and an extensive catalog of standard parts. We have been serving our nation's top defense and space contractors since 1970 by providing expert engineering solutions and highly reliable, innovative products to solve complex challenges. Our Culture: Dream Big. Have Fun. Get Stuff Done. These are the three pillars that make the core of Quantic TRM’s culture. What does that really mean? Dream big feeling empowered to think creatively with no limits, push boundaries and take risks that will positively impact the future of our company. Have fun while you work in an informal, no ego, people first organization filled with passionate, innovative, and committed individuals. Get stuff done in an environment where words like empowerment, accountability, collaboration, and transparency really do exist. Go to work each day with a sense of purpose, helping define and deliver the future of mission-critical electronics. Position Function: The TRM Operations team is responsible for converting customer purchase orders into actionable plans including development deliverables, production plans, supplier delivery schedules and shipping schedules. The Sourcing Specialist, with the support of the Sr. Materials Manager, and in conjunction with Quality Assurance and Engineering, is responsible to create, document and implement sourcing, supply chain and materials planning in a dynamic and diverse IT environment. The Sourcing Specialist, with the Sr. Materials Manager, support the TRM Master Schedule objectives in accordance with annual revenue and profitability objectives. Requirements Primary Roles and Responsibilities Include: · Develop, implement, and publish category strategies that result in an aligned supply base and ERP system processes to meet the needs of the business. · Handle key and preferred supplier relationships · Lead the sourcing process of team formation, research, evaluation, and structure, both new and existing end items. · Create, maintain, and develop an identified sourcing strategy (performance of targeted suppliers, high level assemblies, and second source objectives). · Independently conduct multiple complex sourcing projects. · With product Marketing and Engineering, resolve product lifecycle changes due to regulation changes or component obsolescence. · Support R&D NPI project teams through milestones and ensure stage gate assignments are completed. · Create, document, and deploy procedures for commodity team initiatives, planning to include action plans. · Work with suppliers to establish Strategic Supply Agreements where appropriate. · Develop and execute other strategies to reduce investment in inventory. · Recommend inventory policy (Safety stock, Kanban) based on market trends, costs, etc. · Provide backup to the Materials Management position. Personal Qualifications: · US Person · Ideal candidate has a degree in Business Management, Purchasing, or Supply Chain Management. · CPIM, PMP and APICS certifications highly preferred. · 5-7 years manufacturing, materials, or product engineering experience preferred. · Knowledge and ability to record transactions properly in the ERP System · High degree of accuracy in performance of job responsibilities · Organized and task driven. Quantic TRM is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, work related mental or physical disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled We participate in EVerify. EEO Poster in English EEO Poster in Spanish For more information on our company, please visit www.quanticnow.com as well as www.quantictrm.com PandoLogic. Keywords: Sourcing Agent, Location: Bedford, NH - 03110 , PL: 569353112

job.title: Spark Delivery Driver
job.description: Description Want to be your own boss? With the Spark Driver™ app, you can shop and deliver for customers of Walmart and other local businesses. Available in more than 3,650 cities and all 50 states, the Spark Driver platform makes it possible for you to reach thousands of customers! How it works Enroll using this link Download the Spark Driver app Choose from available offers you want to accept Features Have the freedom and flexibility to earn whenever it's convenient for you. Drivers keep 100% of tips earned Refer & Earn with our Referral Incentive Program. Refer a new driver from an eligible zone and you’ll earn an incentive when they enter your referral code. Incentive programs with a variety of offerings to help make it easier for all drivers to maximize their earning potential Free Walmart+ membership for qualified drivers. See Spark Driver Rewards Program at https://drive4spark.walmart.com/Spark%20Driver%20Rewards%20Program Requirements The Spark Driver app is available on both iOS and Android mobile devices. For best use, we recommend using iOS 11 and newer or Android 5.0 and higher. Additionally, all devices should have a camera with GPS Location Services. Prepaid devices do not support the Spark Driver app You must be 18 years of age or older to complete deliveries with the Spark Driver platform. A clean, smoke-free vehicle Valid proof of auto insurance Valid driver's license and clean driving record Authorization to work in the United States Consent to a background check Sign up now to start earning!

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse- Brentwood
job.description: 02PMAR - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE/LICENSED PSYCHIATRIC TECHNICIAN- BRENTWOOD Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse/ Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$31.00-$33.00 DOE Shifts Needed : AM, PM, OVERNIGHT Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Brentwood, CA ***DURING THIS UNPRECEDENTED TIME (COVID19), PEOPLE’S CARE IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE CARE FOR OUR CONSUMERS BY FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDED CDC GUIDELINES*** COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM, PM , Overnights PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Concord, CA - 94518 , PL: 561590984

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse-Riverside
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Licensed Vocational Nurse-Riverside Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse Hourly Rate : $29.00 Shifts Needed : PM, Full time Work Locations : Riverside, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: PM Work Location: One location Apply at: www.redwoodfcn.com/careers Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Corona, CA - 92878 , PL: 569261642

The role includes greeting patients and visitors as they enter the Nursing Unit. They are the facilitator of meaningful communication between medical staff and the unit’s administrative needs. job.title: Direct Support Professional - Spokane, WA
job.description: Job Title: Direct Support Professional Job Area: Spokane County Shifts Needed: AM & PM - We currently have FT and PT available. Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Do you enjoy seeing the long-lasting impact your efforts make? If you said YES, then we’d love for you to apply today! SAILS Washington is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. The Direct Support Professionals role at SAILS WA is to support adults with developmental or intellectual disabilities to have a higher quality of life. A DSP promotes the health, safety and well-being of the people we support. A DSP will also serve as an advocate for the people we support and their rights. Compensation & Benefits: $18 - 21 per hour Voluntary Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance Voluntary Short-term and Long-term Disability Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Company Paid Basic Life Insurance & ADD plus Voluntary Life Insurance Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO Vacation & Sick Time) Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Working Advantage employee discount program NEW 1/1/2023 – Health Savings Account (HSA) NEW 1/1/2023 – Flexible Savings Account (FSA) NEW 1/9/2023 – 401(K) NEW 1/9/2023 – Capella University Discount Requirements & Qualifications: Both written and spoken English language proficiency required High School Diploma / Equivalent required Washington State Driver’s License, a Reliable Vehicle, Auto Insurance, and must be willing to transport clients Must be located in & eligible/authorized to work in the United States Must be willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations First Aid/CPR Certified (training can be provided) Have an active NAR/HCA/CNA (within 120 days of employment) Have an active CPI certification (preferred, training can be provided) Blood Borne Pathogen (within 120 days of employment, training can be provided) Must be able to lift 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions Be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 (or have an approved exemption) Responsibilities Include but not limited to: Under the direction of the Program Administrator, the DSP will provide each participant with an array of instruction and support services, as described in the participants’ Individual Instruction and Support Plan (IISP). Ensures that the daily needs of the participants are met, including personal hygiene, food preparation, house cleaning, shopping, and monitoring of health needs, supervision of medication. Assists participants with regularly accessing the community to take part in a variety of outings of the participants’ choosing. This may require transporting participants or arranging for transportation. Ensures that participants are treated with dignity and consideration at all times. Promotes and safeguards each participant’s ability to make decisions and to freely exercise his/her rights. For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website: https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ SUPPORT.ADVOCACY.INDEPENDENCE.LIVING.SERVICE PandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Spokane, WA - 99202 , PL: 569343962

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse-Antelope
job.description: 02KRANS - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE OR LICENSED PSYCHIATRIC TECHNICIAN - SACRAMENTO Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse or Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$30.00-33.00 DOE Shifts Needed : Tuesday-Saturday Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Sacramento, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: Tuesday - Saturday 8am - 5pm PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Roseville, CA - 95661 , PL: 561590756

job.description: LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE / LICENSED PSYCHIATRIC TECHNICIAN Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse/ Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$28.00 - $32.00 Shifts Needed : AM/PM Job Status : Full time/Part time Work Location: Vacaville, CA ***DURING THIS UNPRECEDENTED TIME (COVID19), PEOPLE’S CARE ISDEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE CARE FOR OUR CONSUMERS BY FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDEDCDC GUIDELINES*** COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support toindividuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach theirgoals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you toapply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: Day shift Night Shift Work Location: One location PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Napa, CA - 94558 , PL: 569326034

job.title: UNIT COORD
job.description: Your Career. Our Company. Together, We Grow. At Southern Illinois Healthcare (SIH), we realize that in order to provide our surrounding communities with excellent care, we must begin by providing our employees with that same care and appreciation. We offer rich opportunities to develop and grow professionally, an environment of excellence in patient care, and the awareness that everything we accomplish is a direct outgrowth of the superb efforts and dedication of our employees. As a non-profit system of almost 4000 employees, we have won national acclaim for our cancer, cardiac, stroke, bariatric, breast imaging, and rehabilitation services. $14.00/hr minimum - $17.50/hr maximum (range increases based on education, experience and certifications) Responsible for providing clerical support to the Nursing Unit while serving as a resource to employees, patients, and visitors. The role includes greeting patients and visitors as they enter the Nursing Unit. They are the facilitator of meaningful communication between medical staff and the unit’s administrative needs. Responsibilities Safety · Manages processes effectively in regard to employee/patient safety. Record Keeping · Maintains all required records, reports, statistics, logs, files and other documents as required. Process Improvement · Promotes a culture of process improvement by participating in unit/department based programs that supports the system’s process improvement goals. · Actively participates on system-wide or hospital-based teams as needed. Role Specific Responsibilities · Answering phone calls and relaying messages to appropriate staff · Performs daily unit audits to ensure proper care and documentation of safety and quality indicators · Act as a liaison between the Nursing Unit, Quality Improvement, Patient Relations, and other Essential Staff · Assists Manager in achieving strategic performance goals · Assists in preparation of and maintenance of fiscal decisions of departments by overseeing inventory ordering and supply/equipment management · Assists manager with all ETO requests, responsible for approving/denying these requests in API after collaboration with Manager · Assists with control of daily staff rosters, collaborates with Staffing Office, communicates staffing concerns with Supervisors and Manager · Completes phone calls as needed, which may include follow up discharge calls and scheduling patient appointments · Programs staff phone assignments each shift into Epic and Responder 5 · Fax appropriate paperwork as needed, including referrals and other follow up items at discharge, prepare transfer packets as needed · Prepare “Downtime” packets and ensure current forms · Maintain cleanliness of Nursing Station, disinfecting counter tops, phones, and other equipment per shift · Serves as department charge champion, assists manager in managing daily financial responsibilities such as invoice approvals · Facilitates communication between patients and families as needed Qualifications Education · High School Diploma required or equivalent · Associate Degree preferred Licenses and Certification · NA Experience and Skills · Technical Experience: 1 year experience in medical environment with knowledge of Epic preferred. · Proficient in Microsoft Office · Demonstrate exemplary telephone etiquette and possess accurate keyboarding skills #PIQnursing PandoLogic. , Location: Christopher, IL - 62822 , PL: 568892137
