job.title: Caregiver/Direct Support Professional (DSP) Walk-ins/Now Hiring!- Garden Grove
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future Caregiver/Direct Support Professional (DSP) Walk-ins/Now Hiring!- Garden Grove Job Title: Direct Support Professional Caregiver Hourly Rate: $17.00-$18.00 Shifts Needed:Weekends Job Status: Part-Time Work Locations: Garden Grove, CA DATE: Walkins Tuesdays & Thursdays TIME:10am-2pm LOCATION:505 N Tustin Ave #114, Santa Ana, CA 92705 COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered Paid Time Off (PTO) Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care and SAILS Group is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults and adolescents with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do: The Direct Support Professionals supports individuals with developmental disabilities to have quality of life. The Direct Support Professionals promotes the health, safety and well-being of residents. A Direct Support Professionals serves as an advocate for our clients. Essential Functions Outline and prepare daily routine(s) for clients' (visual and active) as written in Individual Program Plan. Support the needs and goals of each resident by participating in the development of IPP/ISP goals. Maintain a clean, safe and healthy environment for the clients. Support the needs and goals of each resident by taking them to visit family and friends, to preferred leisure/recreation activities, and encouraging them to socialize among peers. Assist clients with personal care such as grooming, bathroom needs, changing clients' undergarments and/or clothing if needed. Prepare daily meals and assist with clean-up. Pick-up/drop-off clients in company vans from/to their home/facility (if necessary). Report any incidents or problems and communicate daily with administers. Perform other duties assigned Education and Experience: Must have a High School Diploma or equivalent Must have at least 1 year of professional or personal experience in caregiving (Preferred experience in supporting individuals with developmental disabilities or mental illnesses with challenging behaviors) Direct Support Professional Certificate Year 1 & Year 2 and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention (Preferred or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of hire) First Aid / CPR (Preferred or willing to obtain within 30 days of employment) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidates must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Physical Requirements Must be able to push, pull or lift up to 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. Work Remotely No VISIT OUR CAREER WEBSITE AT http://sailsgroup.org/ Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Irvine, CA - 92612 , PL: 569325998

job.title: Route Sales Representative
job.description: The Route Sales Representative is a full-time position that is responsible for delivering, selling, and merchandising Frito-Lay's complete line of products including Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos, Tostitos, Fritos, and many more to local stores including gas stations, dollar stores, and large grocery stores. As a Route Sales Representative, you drive a Frito-Lay truck to different stores, work independently to unload orders, merchandise product, partner with store managers to increase sales, order, and maintain records throughout the day. What can you expect: Learn the basics of the role to include four to six weeks of dedicated driving and selling training with our amazing team members Run routes for team members', experience different stores, and meet new customers Grow sales on the route by building relationships, selling in displays, and completing national initiatives Attain a route with set days off/schedule with time Work in a fun, fast paced, and physical environment A few of our great benefits include: Paid time off Health care benefits on day one (including dental and vision) Retirement savings benefits such as a pension and 401(k) match Requirements: Be 21 years of age or older Have a valid driver's license with proof of insurance Be able to frequently lift 40 lbs. with or without a reasonable accommodation You'll need to pass a Department of Transportation physical and certification All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy. Please view our Pay Transparency Statement.

At Southern Illinois Healthcare (SIH), we realize that in order to provide our surrounding communities with excellent care, we must begin by providing our employees with that same care and appreciation. We offer rich opportunities to develop and grow professionally, an environment of excellence in patient care, and the awareness that everything we accomplish is a direct outgrowth of the superb efforts and dedication of our employees. As a non-profit system of almost 4000 employees, we have won national acclaim for our cancer, cardiac, stroke, bariatric, breast imaging, and rehabilitation services. $14.00/hr minimum - $17.50/hr maximum (range increases based on education, experience and certifications) Responsible for providing clerical support to the Nursing Unit while serving as a resource to employees, patients, and visitors. The role includes greeting patients and visitors as they enter the Nursing Unit. They are the facilitator of meaningful communication between medical staff and the unit’s administrative needs. Responsibilities Safety · Manages processes effectively in regard to employee/patient safety. Record Keeping · Maintains all required records, reports, statistics, logs, files and other documents as required. Process Improvement · Promotes a culture of process improvement by participating in unit/department based programs that supports the system’s process improvement goals. · Actively participates on system-wide or hospital-based teams as needed. Role Specific Responsibilities · Answering phone calls and relaying messages to appropriate staff · Performs daily unit audits to ensure proper care and documentation of safety and quality indicators · Act as a liaison between the Nursing Unit, Quality Improvement, Patient Relations, and other Essential Staff · Assists Manager in achieving strategic performance goals · Assists in preparation of and maintenance of fiscal decisions of departments by overseeing inventory ordering and supply/equipment management · Assists manager with all ETO requests, responsible for approving/denying these requests in API after collaboration with Manager · Assists with control of daily staff rosters, collaborates with Staffing Office, communicates staffing concerns with Supervisors and Manager · Completes phone calls as needed, which may include follow up discharge calls and scheduling patient appointments · Programs staff phone assignments each shift into Epic and Responder 5 · Fax appropriate paperwork as needed, including referrals and other follow up items at discharge, prepare transfer packets as needed · Prepare “Downtime” packets and ensure current forms · Maintain cleanliness of Nursing Station, disinfecting counter tops, phones, and other equipment per shift · Serves as department charge champion, assists manager in managing daily financial responsibilities such as invoice approvals · Facilitates communication between patients and families as needed Qualifications Education · High School Diploma required or equivalent · Associate Degree preferred Licenses and Certification · NA Experience and Skills · Technical Experience: 1 year experience in medical environment with knowledge of Epic preferred. · Proficient in Microsoft Office · Demonstrate exemplary telephone etiquette and possess accurate keyboarding skills #PIQnursing PandoLogic. , Location: De Soto, IL - 62924 , PL: 568892147

We offer rich opportunities to develop and grow professionally, an environment of excellence in patient care, and the awareness that everything we accomplish is a direct outgrowth of the superb efforts and dedication of our employees. As a non-profit system of almost 4000 employees, we have won national acclaim for our cancer, cardiac, stroke, bariatric, breast imaging, and rehabilitation services. Under supervision of an RN preceptor, the student nurse extern gains experiences and confidence in providing nursing care in a hospital setting. Responsibilities Role Specific Responsibilities · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, assesses patients to determine mental, physical, and spiritual needs · Documents completely, timely, and accurately in the medical record · Establishes a compassionate environment to provide emotional, psychological, and spiritual support to patients and families · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, provides health teaching and counseling to promote, attain, and maintain the optimum health level of patients · Under the supervision of an RN preceptor, serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service professionals · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, assesses, plans, implements and evaluates an individual plan of care in collaboration with the multidisciplinary health care team · Demonstrates ability to use clinical judgement in conjunction with critical thinking to recognize, act upon, and report changes in patient condition · Serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service personnel · Exhibits self-directed growth by seeking educational opportunities to improve knowledge and skills Qualifications Education · Enrollment in an accredited ADN or BSN program Licenses and Certification · Must be a student in good standing in an accredited nursing program and has successfully completed a nursing arts course (e.g., Basics in Nursing, Fundamentals in Nursing, Nursing 101, etc.) · BLS Experience and Skills · Technical Experience: NA #PIQnursing PandoLogic. job.title: Direct Support Professional 1-Oceanside Full time
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL- OCEANSIDE Job Title: Direct Support Professional Hourly Rate: $17.00 - $18.00/hr. Shifts Needed: AM/PM/NOC -Must work one weekend day Job Status: Full Time Work Locations: Oceanside, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered Sick Time Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care and SAILS Group is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults and adolescents with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do: The Direct Support Professionals supports individuals with developmental disabilities to have quality of life. The Direct Support Professionals promotes the health, safety and well-being of residents. A Direct Support Professionals serves as an advocate for our clients. Essential Functions Outline and prepare daily routine(s) for clients' (visual and active) as written in Individual Program Plan. Assist clients with bathroom needs. Change clients' undergarments and/or clothing if needed. Prepare daily meals and assist with clean-up. Pick-up/drop-off clients in company vans from/to their home/facility (if necessary). Education and Experience: Direct Support Professional Certificate Year 1 & Year 2 (Preferred or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of hire) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Physical Requirements Must be able to lift 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. Work Remotely No VISIT OUR CAREER WEBSITE AT: https://www.redwoodfcn.com/ Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. job.title: Direct Support Professional- Simi Valley
job.description: DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL/CAREGIVER- SIMI VALLEY Job Title: Direct Support Professional Hourly Rate: $17.00 - $19.00 Shifts Needed: AM, PM, NOC, Weekends Job Status: Full Time/Part Time Work Locations: Simi Valley, CA ***DURING THIS UNPRECEDENTED TIME (COVID19), PEOPLE’S CARE IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE CARE FOR OUR CONSUMERS BY FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDED CDC GUIDELINES*** COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Paid sick time Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care and The Sails Group is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults and adolescents with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do: The Direct Support Professionals supports individuals with developmental disabilities to have quality of life. The Direct Support Professionals promotes the health, safety and well-being of residents. A Direct Support Professionals serves as an advocate for our clients. Essential Functions Outline and prepare daily routine(s) for clients' (visual and active) as written in Individual Program Plan. Support the needs and goals of each resident by participating in the development of IPP/ISP goals. Maintain a clean, safe and healthy environment for the clients. Support the needs and goals of each resident by taking them to visit family and friends, to preferred leisure/recreation activities, and encouraging them to socialize among peers. Assist clients with personal care such as grooming, bathroom needs, changing clients' undergarments and/or clothing if needed. Prepare daily meals and assist with clean-up. Pick-up/drop-off clients in company vans from/to their home/facility (if necessary). Report any incidents or problems and communicate daily with administers. Perform other duties assigned Education and Experience: Must have a High School Diploma or equivalent Must have at least 1 year of professional or personal experience in caregiving (Preferred experience in supporting individuals with developmental disabilities or mental illnesses with challenging behaviors) Direct Support Professional Certificate Year 1 & Year 2 and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention (Preferred or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of hire) First Aid / CPR (Preferred or willing to obtain within 30 days of employment) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidates must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Physical Requirements Must be able to push, pull or lift up to 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. Work Remotely No PandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Santa Clarita, CA - 91390 , PL: 561591043

job.title: RN Patient Navigator - Primary Care
job.description: Employment Type: Full time Shift: Description: *Annual Wellness Visits * Collaborates with physicians, hospital staff on developing policies and procedures for the care of the patient. * Coordinates and facilitates treatment objectives for the patient. * Develops informational and educational materials for this patient population. * Communicates the plan to primary care physicians and obtains consensus for participation in this service. Education & Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: * Graduate of an accredited school of Nursing required; BSN preferred Licensure * Registered Nurse in the State of Florida * Certified in Basic Life Support (BLS) by the American Heart Association Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Trinity Health is a family of 115,000 colleagues and nearly 26,000 physicians and clinicians across 25 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions. Our dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention, and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse - Fillmore $500 Sign-On Bonus!
job.description: 02HOWE - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE - FILLMORE Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse/ Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$30.00 Shifts Needed : AM Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Fillmore, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! $500 sign-on bonus* People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Oxnard, CA - 93032 , PL: 569325878

job.title: Fleet Maintenance Mechanic / Technician
job.description: Create Your Experience of a Lifetime! Come work and play in the mountains! Whether it’s your first-time seeing snow or you were born on the slopes, joining our team means discovering (or re-discovering!) a passion for the outdoors while building lifelong connections with teammates and guests from around the world. With 40+ resorts across 3 continents, you can join our team for a season or stay to build a career. From day one, you'll receive some of the highest compensation rates in the industry, free Epic pass(es) along with free ski and snowboard lessons, 40% retail discounts, the chance to grow through Epic Service - our leading training and development experience, and wellness benefits to fuel your success. Job Benefits Ski/Mountain Perks! Free passes for employees, employee discounted lift tickets for friends and family AND free ski lessons MORE employee discounts on lodging, food, gear, and mountain shuttles 401(k) Retirement Plan Employee Assistance Program Excellent training and professional development Referral Program Full Time roles are eligible for the above, plus: Health Insurance; Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, and Vision Insurance plans (for eligible seasonal employees after working 500 hours) Free ski passes for dependents Critical Illness and Accident plans Job Summary: Our year-round Vehicle Maintenance team executes safety best practices to the best of our ability, as well as maintain a fun, friendly, and positive attitude every day, with all guests and employees. We are an internal based guest service department; we want to make sure we leave our teams with a positive experience. This role provides maintenance and repair services for our state of the art fleet. This position is eligible for a tool allowance, ski pass, along with other benefits found here! Job Specifications: Expected Pay Range: $21.00 - $30.00 / hour Shift & Schedule Availability: Full-Time Skill Level: Entry, Intermediate, Advanced Our Fleet: Snowcats Snowmobiles Heavy Equipment Light Duty Trucks Shuttle and Transit Buses Small Engine Equipment Job Responsibilities: Utilize vehicle and equipment technical knowledge, skills, and abilities to optimize equipment downtime, which includes and not limited to: Gas / Diesel Engine Repair and Diagnosis Drive Train Repair and Diagnosis Electrical Repair and Diagnosis Brake System Repair and Diagnosis Steering and Suspension Repair and Diagnosis Preventative Maintenance on Fleet Vehicles Welding / Fabrication Hydraulics Engages around priorities to foster engagement, collaboration, and results Supports the professional growth and development of employees across all levels of the organization Other duties as assigned Job Requirements: Vehicle maintenance experience, especially with types of vehicles in our fleet, or mechanical aptitude Must have a valid driver’s license / clean DMV record Must have own tools or be willing to purchase as necessary Must have the ability to lift 50 pounds regularly The expected pay range is $21.00 - $30.00. This is the pay range we reasonably expect to pay for this position. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors. Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. Requisition ID 495082 Reference Date: 06/08/2023 Job Code Function:Fleet Maintenance

How it works Enroll using this link Download the Spark Driver app Choose from available offers you want to accept Features Have the freedom and flexibility to earn whenever it's convenient for you. Incentive programs with a variety of offerings to help make it easier for all drivers to maximize their earning potential Free Walmart+ membership for qualified drivers. See Spark Driver Rewards Program at https://drive4spark.walmart.com/Spark%20Driver%20Rewards%20Program Requirements The Spark Driver app is available on both iOS and Android mobile devices. Prepaid devices do not support the Spark Driver app You must be 18 years of age or older to complete deliveries with the Spark Driver platform. job.title: Direct Support Professional
job.description: Changing Lives Shaping The Future DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL/CAREGIVER Job Title: Direct Support Professional Hourly Rate: $17.00 - $19.00 Shifts Needed: AM,PM,Weekends Job Status: Full Time/Part Time Work Locations: West Hills ***DURING THIS UNPRECEDENTED TIME (COVID19), PEOPLE’S CARE IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE CARE FOR OUR CONSUMERS BY FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDED CDC GUIDELINES*** COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Paid sick time Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care and The Sails Group is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults and adolescents with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do: The Direct Support Professionals supports individuals with developmental disabilities to have quality of life. The Direct Support Professionals promotes the health, safety and well-being of residents. A Direct Support Professionals serves as an advocate for our clients. Essential Functions Outline and prepare daily routine(s) for clients' (visual and active) as written in Individual Program Plan. Support the needs and goals of each resident by participating in the development of IPP/ISP goals. Maintain a clean, safe and healthy environment for the clients. Support the needs and goals of each resident by taking them to visit family and friends, to preferred leisure/recreation activities, and encouraging them to socialize among peers. Assist clients with personal care such as grooming, bathroom needs, changing clients' undergarments and/or clothing if needed. Prepare daily meals and assist with clean-up. Pick-up/drop-off clients in company vans from/to their home/facility (if necessary). Report any incidents or problems and communicate daily with administers. Perform other duties assigned Education and Experience: Must have a High School Diploma or equivalent Must have at least 1 year of professional or personal experience in caregiving (Preferred experience in supporting individuals with developmental disabilities or mental illnesses with challenging behaviors) Direct Support Professional Certificate Year 1 & Year 2 and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention (Preferred or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of hire) First Aid / CPR (Preferred or willing to obtain within 30 days of employment) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidates must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Physical Requirements Must be able to push, pull or lift up to 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. Work Remotely No VISIT OUR CAREER WEBSITE AT: https://peoplescare.com/careers Providing Excellent Support and AdvocacyPandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Los Angeles, CA - 90040 , PL: 567457952

Responsibilities Safety · Manages processes effectively in regard to employee/patient safety. · Record Keeping · Maintains all required records, reports, statistics, logs, files and other documents as required, including but not limited to payroll, schedules and status changes. · Process Improvement · Promotes a culture of process improvement by establishing unit/department based programs that supports the system’s process improvement goals. · Actively participates on system-wide or hospital-based teams. · Role Specific Responsibilities · Assess patients to determine mental, physical, and spiritual needs. · Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates an individual plan of care in collaboration with the multidisciplinary health care team. · Provides explanations and instructions to patient/responsible person. · Demonstrate ability to use nursing clinical judgment to recognize and report changes in patient condition. · Contribute to a healthy workplace environment by managing conflict using professional communication skills. · Meets Core Measure responsibilities related to patient care. · Participate in continuing education. · Maintain complete and accurate medical records. · Charge RN-Monitors workload and delegates responsibilities. · Charge RN-Assists Unit Manager with daily operations. · Charge RN-Rounds with physicians. · Qualifications · Associate, Diploma, Bachelor Degree or Master’s in Nursing #PIQnursing PandoLogic. Keywords: Registered Nurse (RN), Location: Marion, IL - 62959 , PL: 562235921

job.title: Route Sales Representative
job.description: The Route Sales Representative is a full-time position that is responsible for delivering, selling, and merchandising Frito-Lay's complete line of products including Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos, Tostitos, Fritos, and many more to local stores including gas stations, dollar stores, and large grocery stores. As a Route Sales Representative, you drive a Frito-Lay truck to different stores, work independently to unload orders, merchandise product, partner with store managers to increase sales, order, and maintain records throughout the day. What can you expect: Learn the basics of the role to include four to six weeks of dedicated driving and selling training with our amazing team members Run routes for team members', experience different stores, and meet new customers Grow sales on the route by building relationships, selling in displays, and completing national initiatives Attain a route with set days off/schedule with time Work in a fun, fast paced, and physical environment A few of our great benefits include: Paid time off Health care benefits on day one (including dental and vision) Retirement savings benefits such as a pension and 401(k) match Requirements: Be 21 years of age or older Have a valid driver's license with proof of insurance Be able to frequently lift 40 lbs. with or without a reasonable accommodation You'll need to pass a Department of Transportation physical and certification All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy. Please view our Pay Transparency Statement.

job.title: Student Nurse Extern
job.description: Your Career. Our Company. Together, We Grow. At Southern Illinois Healthcare (SIH), we realize that in order to provide our surrounding communities with excellent care, we must begin by providing our employees with that same care and appreciation. We offer rich opportunities to develop and grow professionally, an environment of excellence in patient care, and the awareness that everything we accomplish is a direct outgrowth of the superb efforts and dedication of our employees. As a non-profit system of almost 4000 employees, we have won national acclaim for our cancer, cardiac, stroke, bariatric, breast imaging, and rehabilitation services. Under supervision of an RN preceptor, the student nurse extern gains experiences and confidence in providing nursing care in a hospital setting. Responsibilities Role Specific Responsibilities · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, assesses patients to determine mental, physical, and spiritual needs · Documents completely, timely, and accurately in the medical record · Establishes a compassionate environment to provide emotional, psychological, and spiritual support to patients and families · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, provides health teaching and counseling to promote, attain, and maintain the optimum health level of patients · Under the supervision of an RN preceptor, serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service professionals · Under supervision of an RN preceptor, assesses, plans, implements and evaluates an individual plan of care in collaboration with the multidisciplinary health care team · Demonstrates ability to use clinical judgement in conjunction with critical thinking to recognize, act upon, and report changes in patient condition · Serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service personnel · Exhibits self-directed growth by seeking educational opportunities to improve knowledge and skills Qualifications Education · Enrollment in an accredited ADN or BSN program Licenses and Certification · Must be a student in good standing in an accredited nursing program and has successfully completed a nursing arts course (e.g., Basics in Nursing, Fundamentals in Nursing, Nursing 101, etc.) · BLS Experience and Skills · Technical Experience: NA #PIQnursing PandoLogic. Keywords: Student Nurse, Location: Logan, IL - 62856 , PL: 568892247

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse- Brentwood
job.description: 02PMAR - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE/LICENSED PSYCHIATRIC TECHNICIAN- BRENTWOOD Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse/ Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$31.00-$33.00 DOE Shifts Needed : AM, PM, OVERNIGHT Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Brentwood, CA ***DURING THIS UNPRECEDENTED TIME (COVID19), PEOPLE’S CARE IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SAFE CARE FOR OUR CONSUMERS BY FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDED CDC GUIDELINES*** COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM, PM , Overnights PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Brentwood, CA - 94513 , PL: 560818658

job.title: Registered Veterinary Technician (RVT)
job.description: Pacific Animal Hospital is seeking a full time Registered Veterinary Technician to join our team! We invest heavily in our employees with many opportunities for growth and development! We offer outstanding benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401K, life insurance, paid time off, continuing education, generous pet discounts and much more! We are an AAHA-accredited hospital in beautiful Oceanside, CA. Our practice sees small animals 7 days a week. We offer a diverse caseload with a lot of collaboration on a variety of medical and emergency cases. We offer a 4x10hr shift full-time schedule! Compensation: negotiable based on credentials and experience with a hourly pay rate starting at $20- $27 / hour. The actual rate offered will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Job duties include, but are not limited to: Assist veterinarians with gathering patient histories Establish and carry out treatment plans Be involved in anesthetic procedures (preparation, induction, intubation, monitoring, dental cleanings and digital radiographs, recovery). Communicate pertinent information about patient care to clients Maintain hospital and patient cleanliness using aseptic technique, proper protective equipment, and isolation protocol Frequently lift and move patients up to 40lbs. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Ability to communicate with employees and clients in a professional and courteous manner Ability to multi-task and establish priorities Ability to pay close attention to detail and ensure accuracy of patient care, charge entry, etc. Knowledge of the services the hospital provides and the species it treats. Skill in operating equipment, including computers and software Skilled in client education in a general practice setting. IV Catheter placement / Venipuncture. Radiology, Cystocentesis. Experience inducing, intubating and monitoring anesthesia for routine surgeries. Experience or interest in dentals a plus! Veterinary technician experience of 2+ years. CA RVT license or working towards licensure strongly preferred Apply today, we look forward to hearing from you! #LI-SB1PandoLogic. Keywords: Veterinary Technician, Location: Oceanside, CA - 92054 , PL: 567140486

job.title: Per Diem Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Spokane County
job.description: Job Title: Direct Support Professional Job Area: Spokane County Job Shift: Varies Job Schedule: Per-Diem Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Do you need the flexibility a per-diem schedule provides? If you said YES, then we’d love for you to apply today! SAILS WA is a part of the Redwood Family Care Network and we take our mission to heart. Our mission is to provide world-class, person-centered services that promote choice, independence, and the opportunity for growth. This is achieved through working partnerships and integrated care coordination. The Per-Diem Direct Support Professionals role at SAILS WA is to support adults with developmental or intellectual disabilities to have a higher quality of life. A DSP promotes the health, safety and well-being of the people we support. A DSP will also serve as an advocate for the people we support and their rights. Compensation & Benefits: $18 - 21 per hour Unlimited Peer Referral Program Payday on demand through Dayforce Wallet Flexible schedule that fits your lifestyle Requirements & Qualifications: Both written and spoken English language proficiency required High School Diploma / Equivalent required Washington State Driver’s License, a Reliable Vehicle, Auto Insurance, and must be willing to transport clients Must be located in & eligible/authorized to work in the United States Must be willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations First Aid/CPR Certified (training can be provided) Have an active NAR/HCA/CNA Have an active CPI certification (preferred) Blood Borne Pathogen (within 120 days of employment, training can be provided) Must be able to lift 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions Be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 (or have an approved exemption) Performance, Responsibilities and Standards: Under the supervision of the Assistant Director and Administrators, the Per-Diem Direct Support Professional: *Per Diem employees are required to pick up minimum of (1) shift a month or will not be considered an employee of SAILS Washington per our policy *Per Diem employees can work up to (31) hours a week, but cannot work more or will be considered a Full-Time employee and will have to move into Full-time status Provides support to program participants that meets their needs, provides opportunities for community integration, including swimming, and creates a nurturing, safe, and healthful living environment. Must check in weekly with Assistant Directors or Administrators in regards to open shifts for the week. Can pick up shifts at multiple programs but needs to orient to plans before working with client. Must have all training before becoming a Per Diem employee. Must keep up to date with all training with our Training Manager. Must complete Per Diem checklist and trainings on a monthly basis. Must be familiar with the Residential Service Guidelines issued by the Division of Developmental Disabilities. Provides each participant with an array of instruction and support services, as described in the participants’ Individual Instruction and Support Plan (IISP). Ensures that the daily needs of the participants are met, including personal hygiene, food preparation, house cleaning, shopping, and monitoring of health needs, including supervision of medication. Assists participants with regularly accessing the community to take part in a variety of outings of the participants’ choosing. This may require transporting participants or arranging for transportation. Ensures that participants are treated with dignity and consideration at all times. Promotes and safeguards each participant’s ability to make decisions and to freely exercise his or her rights. Interacts with participants, provides informal counseling and problem-solving with participants. Attends staff meetings as required by the Program Supervisor or the Site Supervisor and/or Administrator. Attends training offered/required by the agency, DDA, and other parties. Takes part in the development and implementation of the IISP for each participant with whom they work. Will become Nurse Assistant Registered (NAR) at employee’s own expense initially and annually. Must enroll and complete Nurse Delegation study course and take test within 30 days of employment. Provides necessary support and supervision of participants. Maintains professional working relationships with other services providers, the participants’ parents/relatives/guardians and other agency staff. Responsible for timely completion of all documentation, including, but not limited to, the medication log, shift notes, progress notes, data sheets, incident reports, and client financial records. Performs other duties as assigned by the Program Supervisor or the Site Supervisor and/or the Administrator. Must have a valid driver’s license and car and must be willing to transport clients in own vehicle. If you are unfamiliar with the term "Per-Diem": Similar terms are "as-needed" or "on-call" For more information, or to learn about other opportunities with Sails Washington, please visit our parent company's website: https://www.redwoodfcn.com/careers/ SUPPORT.ADVOCACY.INDEPENDENCE.LIVING.SERVICE PandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Veradale, WA - 99037 , PL: 569325746

job.title: Direct Support Professional - Thousand Oaks $500 Sign on bonus!
job.description: DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL/CAREGIVER Job Title: Direct Support Professional Hourly Rate: $17.00 - $19.00 Shifts Needed: AM, PM, NOC, Weekends Job Status: Full Time/Part Time Work Locations: Thousand Oaks, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Paid sick time Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! $500 Sign-on bonus* People's Care and The Sails Group is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults and adolescents with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's what you’ll do: The Direct Support Professionals supports individuals with developmental disabilities to have quality of life. The Direct Support Professionals promotes the health, safety and well-being of residents. A Direct Support Professionals serves as an advocate for our clients. Essential Functions Outline and prepare daily routine(s) for clients' (visual and active) as written in Individual Program Plan. Support the needs and goals of each resident by participating in the development of IPP/ISP goals. Maintain a clean, safe and healthy environment for the clients. Support the needs and goals of each resident by taking them to visit family and friends, to preferred leisure/recreation activities, and encouraging them to socialize among peers. Assist clients with personal care such as grooming, bathroom needs, changing clients' undergarments and/or clothing if needed. Prepare daily meals and assist with clean-up. Pick-up/drop-off clients in company vans from/to their home/facility (if necessary). Report any incidents or problems and communicate daily with administers. Perform other duties assigned Education and Experience: Must have a High School Diploma or equivalent Must have at least 1 year of professional or personal experience in care giving (Preferred experience in supporting individuals with developmental disabilities or mental illnesses with challenging behaviors) Direct Support Professional Certificate Year 1 & Year 2 and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention (Preferred or willing to obtain within the first 6 months of hire) First Aid / CPR (Preferred or willing to obtain within 30 days of employment) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidates must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Physical Requirements Must be able to push, pull or lift up to 50lbs. Able to work both indoors and outdoors in all weather conditions. Work Remotely No *$500 sign-on bonus paid after 90 days of employment* PandoLogic. Keywords: Direct Support Professional (DSP), Location: Thousand Oaks, CA - 91362 , PL: 569326406

job.title: LPN Transition to Practice
job.description: Responsible for assisting with professional nursing care for SIH patients with an RN preceptor Responsibilities Safety · Manages processes effectively in regard to employee/patient safety. · Record Keeping · Maintains all required records, reports, statistics, logs, files and other documents as required, including but not limited to payroll, schedules and status changes. · Process Improvement · Promotes a culture of process improvement by establishing unit/department based programs that supports the system & process improvement goals.Actively participates on system-wide or hospital-based teams. · Collects data and collaborating in the assessment of the health status of a patient · Collaborates in the development and modification of the RN’s comprehensive nursing plan of care for all types of patients. · Implements aspects of the plan of care as delegated. · Participates in health teaching and counseling to promote, attain, and maintain the optimum health level of patients as delegated. · Serves as an advocate for the patient by communicating and collaborating with other health service personnel as delegated. · Participates in the evaluation of patient responses to interventions. · Communicates and collaborates with other health care professionals as delegated. · Provides input into the development of policies and procedures to support patient safety. · Provides patient/family instructions. · Qualifications · Graduate of LPN Program · Currently Enrolled in RN completion program #PIQnursing PandoLogic. job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse - Fillmore $500 Sign-On Bonus!
job.description: 02HOWE - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE - FILLMORE Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse/ Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$30.00 Shifts Needed : AM Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Fillmore, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! $500 sign-on bonus* People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: AM PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Fillmore, CA - 93015 , PL: 569252378

job.title: Board Certified Behavioral Consultant- Sacramento and surrounding areas
job.description: 01PCBH - BCBA Board Certified Behavioral Analyst Location: Sacramento, CA Salary Range: $83,000 - $87,000 annually Job Summary: Provide ongoing consultation using principles of Applied Behavior Analysis. Design, implement, write, and maintain Behavior Support Plans as needed, using the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis. Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments as needed. Regular review and maintenance of data collection towards behavior plan goals. Conduct ongoing training and provide ongoing support for direct service professionals, home administrators, program managers, and other professionals as needed. Attend multidisciplinary meetings and collaborate with other professionals in ongoing development and maintenance of behavior support plans. Knowledge, Skill and Abilities Knowledge: Regional Center Developmental Centers and ICF/DD Developmental Disabilities Mental Health Diagnoses Skills: BCBA Certification Development and Implementation of Behavior Support Plans Person-Centered approach to problem solving Abilities: Ability to problem solve in a fast-paced environment with multiple inputs from various stakeholders. Ability to independently gather information in making a decision. Ability to research topics or areas of specialty that are unfamiliar. Work independently when limited supervision is present. Communicate clearly and effectively with others Essential Functions: Attend meetings, conferences, and conduct trainings in support of staff in behavior support plan implementation. Must have reliable transportation when home circumstances require in-home visitation. Potential ongoing supervision for RBT candidates and certificate holders as needed. Review and analyze data to evaluate effectiveness of behavior support plans and make changes as needed. Job responsibilities are performed using a combination of in-person and indirect (remote) service. Education and Experience: Master’s degree in related field preferred, BCBA credential required Minimum 3 years of designing and implementing behavior support plan. Experience with adults with developmental disabilities. Physical Requirements: The ability to lift 25 pounds regularly. The ability to respond quickly to sounds. The ability to see and respond to dangerous situations. Other Requirements: This position will require a valid California ID or Driver’s License. Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to background check, physical etc. If required to drive, candidate must possess proof of valid insurance and registration. Must be at least 21 years of age to drive for People's Care. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $83,000.00 - $87,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee discount Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations: All employees are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or be able to submit a medical or religious exemption. Education: Master's (Required) Experience: designing and implementing behavior support plan: 3 years (Preferred) License/Certification: BCBA (Required) Willingness to travel: 25% (Preferred) Work Location: On the road PandoLogic. Keywords: Behavior Analyst, Location: Roseville, CA - 95661 , PL: 569325770

job.title: Licensed Therapist
job.company: Bailard House, LLC dba Beachside Teen Treatment Center
job.description: Join an Outstanding Team that Shares Knowledge and Gain Exposure to Diverse Treatments Reasonable Caseload · Beautiful Settings · Advancement Opportunities You're a licensed LMFT or LCSW who's registered with California BBS, and a team player who enjoys sharing your knowledge with peers. If that describes you, and you have a genuine interest in working with adolescents in residential treatment, this role offers some compelling advantages. You will: Join an outstanding, supportive team including three clinicians, one student, and your supervisor, the Clinical Director. The team values knowledge-sharing and mentorship. Gain exposure to a variety of treatment modalities, including CBT, DBT and more. We also offer various CEUs free of charge. Focus on what you do best with a reasonable caseload including both individual and group sessions. You'll have flexibility in scheduling sessions. Work with a supervisor who has an excellent reputation as a mentor and resource, and have the opportunity to grow your career here. We hire from within whenever possible. Work at two attractive facilities with beautiful, resort-like settings. You'll enjoy chef-prepared lunches as well as available snacks and coffee. This is a full-time licensed therapist role working Sunday - Thursday days from 10 am - 6 pm, and supporting clients at two adolescent residential facilities. The pay range is up to $90,000, depending on experience. Your Qualifications To be a good fit for the Licensed Therapist opportunity, you will have: Licensed LMFT or LCSW, and registration with California BBS. A genuine desire to work with the adolescent population we serve. Understanding of counseling and other treatment procedures for mental health disorders with co-occurring substance abuse issues. Computer proficiency; experience with documentation and EMR systems desired. Exceptional interpersonal skills and service orientation. The Job Under the supervision of the Clinical Director, you will work with the clinical staff in the assessment of client needs, treatment planning, and facilitation. You'll advocate for options and services to meet an individual’s mental and physical health needs through communication and available resources to promote quality cost-effective outcomes. You'll work with both residential clients in two separate facilities, approximately 20-25 minutes apart. You'll manage a reasonable caseload and be responsible for providing three sessions per client each week -- one family and two individual sessions. You'll also have twelve group sessions per week, six at each site. Beachside Teen Treatment Center is a tranquil, rehabilitation haven for adolescents struggling with addiction, substance abuse and co-occurring mental health disorders. Our beautiful residential facility is based in Malibu, California, with panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean. At Hillcrest Adolescent Treatment Center, our mission is to provide healing resources for adolescents battling substance abuse with co-occurring mental health disorders. Hillcrest’s rustic but elegant homestead is set in the lush foothills of Agoura Hills. This rural estate is both private and peaceful, making it an ideal enclave for rehabilitation and healing. Beachside and Hillcrest are part of Centered Health, which operates a diverse network of behavioral health treatment centers ensuring that clients receive individualized comprehensive care in the most appropriate setting. Our goal is to value the skills each person brings to the team and provide an environment that embraces diversity and rewards imagination and service delivery. EOE/AA/M/F/Vets/Disabled

job.title: Spark Delivery Driver - Hiring Immediately
job.description: Description Want to be your own boss? With the Spark Driver™ app, you can shop and deliver for customers of Walmart and other local businesses. Available in more than 3,650 cities and all 50 states, the Spark Driver platform makes it possible for you to reach thousands of customers! How it works Enroll using this link Download the Spark Driver app Choose from available offers you want to accept Features Have the freedom and flexibility to earn whenever it's convenient for you. Drivers keep 100% of tips earned Refer & Earn with our Referral Incentive Program. Refer a new driver from an eligible zone and you’ll earn an incentive when they enter your referral code. Incentive programs with a variety of offerings to help make it easier for all drivers to maximize their earning potential Free Walmart+ membership for qualified drivers. See Spark Driver Rewards Program at https://drive4spark.walmart.com/Spark%20Driver%20Rewards%20Program Requirements The Spark Driver app is available on both iOS and Android mobile devices. For best use, we recommend using iOS 11 and newer or Android 5.0 and higher. Additionally, all devices should have a camera with GPS Location Services. Prepaid devices do not support the Spark Driver app You must be 18 years of age or older to complete deliveries with the Spark Driver platform. A clean, smoke-free vehicle Valid proof of auto insurance Valid driver's license and clean driving record Authorization to work in the United States Consent to a background check Sign up now to start earning!

job.title: Registered Nurse
job.description: Registered Nurse - Pinnacle Home Care Department: Home Health Location: Jacksonville, FL Remote Policy: Onsite/Must be willing to drive to individual patients' homes Type of Employment: Full Time Salary: $75K - $80K / yr Job Description: We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Nurse to join our team at Pinnacle Home Care. As a part of our Home Health department, you will play a vital role in providing exceptional care to patients in the comfort of their own homes. If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of others, then we want to hear from you! Responsibilities: Complete an initial assessment of patients and determine home care needs. Develops a care plan involving patients and their family. Medication/pain management Re-evaluate patient nursing needs. Initiate the plan of care and make necessary revisions. Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures. Acts as Case Manager when assigned by Clinical Supervisor and assumes responsibility to coordinate patient care for assigned caseload. Qualifications: Associate’s or bachelor’s degree with One (1) to Two (2) years of recent acute care experience in an institutional setting. Two (2) years of home health experience preferred. Must be licensed in the state as a Registered Nurse (RN) Current CPR certification Licensed driver with an automobile that is in good working order and insured in accordance with the organization’s requirements. Excellent observation, verbal and written communication skills, problem-solving skills, basic math skills and nursing skills per competency checklist. Skills: Effective time management and organizational skills Proficient in using electronic medical records (EMR) systems Ability to adapt to changing environments and prioritize tasks Empathy and compassion towards patients and their families Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation Benefits: Work/Life balance Unlimited PTO for salaried (FT) employees which means more family time, fun and relaxation. Live QA to assist with Oasis documentation Competitive pay and benefits, 6 paid holidays, matching 401K Paid Mileage Tablet/iPad Provided Office provided PPE Supportive and Positive workplace 1:1 Patient Care-creating a personal connection Comprehensive and interactive orientation, training, and preceptor Ongoing training plus growth opportunities. Referral bonuses Salary range: $75,000 - $80,000 yearly

job.title: Certified Surgical Tech, FT, days, St. Mary's Hospital, Athens
job.description: Employment Type: Full time Shift: Day Shift Description: A clinically competent surgical technologist, under the supervision of the Registered Nurse, is responsible for the care and safety of the patient during the intraoperative period. Included within this assignment is the responsibility for assisting with preparation of surgical patient by performance of routine and delegated duties according to standards and policies of the hospital. The work hours for this position will be Monday - Friday, 7:00am til 3:30pm with call. Licensure/Certification/Registration: Must possess a current CST license. Education: High School graduate, graduate of an accredited school or Surgical Technology program. Experience: Must possess a minimum of one year current operating room experience (student experience allowed). Possesses a service orientation, should possess the ability to understand and react effectively to the unique needs and care for all patient populations. (i.e. neonatal, pediatrics, adolescents, geriatrics). Special Qualifications: Knowledge and understanding of basic principles of asepsis, simple biology, leadership qualities, the ability to work independently, demonstrates effective communication and organizational skills. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Trinity Health is a family of 115,000 colleagues and nearly 26,000 physicians and clinicians across 25 states. Because we serve diverse populations, our colleagues are trained to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve and to apply that knowledge to produce positive health outcomes. We also recognize that each of us has a different way of thinking and perceiving our world and that these differences often lead to innovative solutions. Our dedication to diversity includes a unified workforce (through training and education, recruitment, retention, and development), commitment and accountability, communication, community partnerships, and supplier diversity.

job.title: Licensed Vocational Nurse-Antelope
job.description: 02KRANS - Licensed Vocational Nurse LICENSED VOCATIONAL NURSE OR LICENSED PSYCHIATRIC TECHNICIAN - SACRAMENTO Job Title : Licensed Vocational Nurse or Licensed Psychiatric Technician Hourly Rate :$30.00-33.00 DOE Shifts Needed : Tuesday-Saturday Job Status : Full time Work Locations : Sacramento, CA COME JOIN OUR TEAM! Do you have a passion for providing quality support to individuals with special needs? Do you thrive on helping others build/reach their goals in a positive, life-enriching environment? Then we'd love for you to apply! Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance offered 401(K) Paid Time Off Company Perks and Discounts NEW ON-DEMAND PAY! People's Care is hiring compassionate amazing providers to support and care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Here's What You'll Do JOB SUMMARY: The LVN is responsible to assist the with the coordination of the home so that the residents' health and safety needs are met. The Lead assists to maintain compliance under the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title 17 and Title 22 as well as the Lanterman Act (Welfare and Institutions Code). The LVN is expected to ensure residents to maximize independence. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Administer medications to individuals and follow the five rights for verification purposes Attend residents’ doctor appointments and address any concerns and changes with the attending physician Assist individuals with activities of daily living such as bathing, cleaning, preparing meals, grooming, cooking, cleaning etc. Assess residents’ and participants’ wounds, help with dressing change and breathing treatments, as needed Audit all medications during a new medication cycle and check the five rights for verification Perform g-tube insertions for feeding to individuals Perform colostomy care to individuals Perform intramuscular injections Perform diabetes insulin medication injection to individuals Evaluate residents’ and participants’ level of consciousness, neurological factors, and whether they are responsive and oriented post seizure and/or any traumatic episodes Redirect in the event of a behavioral episode and continue to support and listen to individual’s needs Complete and update client notes system on a daily basis. Observe and report any unusual behaviors and injuries so both Behavior Consultant and Administrator are fully informed Assess and identify sign and symptoms of infections (early and late signs) Perform basic physical review such as checking for vital signs, (understanding normal and abnormal measures) and head to toe assessments Participate in community outing events with the individuals such as hiking, going to the beach, and other leisure activities Performs other related duties and assignments as required REQUIREMENTS: 1 Year Experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities Licensed Vocational Nurse License (Required) Must have First Aid / CPR and CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) Must be at least 21 years of age Must have a California Driver’s License Candidate must successfully pass all pre-employment requirements, including but not limited to a background check. Shift availability: Tuesday - Saturday 8am - 5pm PandoLogic. Keywords: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN), Location: Antelope, CA - 95843 , PL: 560829968
